page.title: 13GIPSY SITE, CROSS HOUSES
page.content: {At the junction}of the Pitchford road with the main road (A458), there is a small triangular area of land. It was a sand and gravel quarry, then filled in when a rubbish tip and on levelling became used by the County Council for storing road gravel etc. About 8 years ago 1 or 2 gipsy caravans moved onto this patch. Recently, as many as 6 trailers have been based there. {The Council}are now agreed to{upgrade the land at the road junction to an official site for about 5 years to accommodate 4 or 5 trailers. Water and toilets will be provided shortly. {A permanent site}for travellers is being sought for the Shrewsbury area and there are possibilities it could be in the Cross Houses/Berrington region.
